title: BBC Local Live: Shropshire on Friday 2 June 2017 - BBC News
summary: children as young as eight reported over racist incidents in schools .
£ 60k project under way to improve stretch of the river worfe .
over 20 awards for whitchurch cheese maker .
broadcast date for telford diy sos episode .

documents.title: motorcyclist dies in crash near oswestry
text: a motorcyclist has died after a crash near oswestry yesterday afternoon .
the man , in his 20s , was riding on the a483 at sweeney when the crash happened .
the driver of the other vehicle , a black hyundai , was unhurt .

documents.title: work on major roundabout to finish soon
text: shropshire council says there 's now just `` minor finishing-off works '' to be carried out on shrewsbury 's meole brace roundabout .
redevelopment of the island , which involves a new road being built through the middle of it , started back in february .
the council expects additional roadworks here to continue for another week .
delays and diversions are still in place at the reabrook island near the shirehall and old potts way .

documents.title: crews fight fire at builders ' merchant
text: a huge fire broke out at a builders ' merchant in ellesmere at the weekend .
six crews attended the blaze at the tudor griffiths site , which is believed to have been started in two large industrial machines and recycled wood and chippings on saturday evening .

documents.title: a49 'nightmare ' roadworks spell traffic chaos as talks continue to ease disruption
text: a 10-day closure of one of shropshire 's busiest trunk roads will be a `` nightmare '' - but there is no getting around it , motorists were told today .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: blue plaque unveiled in shropshire
text: a blue plaque has been unveiled in bishop 's castle to commemorate musician and singer songwriter , jerry lordan .
former radio 1 dj and chairman of the british plaque trust , mike read unveiled the plaque outside the three tuns in bishop 's castle .
the singer , musician and writer jerry lordan lived near the town and was nominated to receive a blue plaque as part of a bbc music day project .
he wrote the shadows ' hit apache and dozens of other well known songs for cliff richard , jet harris and tony meehan .

documents.title: video : your 50-second weather forecast
text: rain gradually moving in from the west this morning , becoming heavy and persistent in some places this afternoon with highs of 15c ( 59f ) .
author: Lucy Martin
BBC Weather

documents.title: the tiny snail with a huge part to play
text: the tiny snail with a huge part to play
author: David Gregory-Kumar
Science, Environment & Rural Affairs Correspondent

documents.title: good morning from the bbc shropshire newsroom
text: i and the team will be bringing you the latest news , sport , travel and weather between now and 18.00 .
you can comment on our stories and share your by email , facebook or twitter .
author: Les Walton
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on monday .

documents.title: john prescott to campaign in ironbridge tomorrow
text: the former labour deputy leader john prescott is hitting the campaign trail in shropshire tomorrow .
he 's visiting ironbridge to support their candidate in telford .
jeremy corbyn had been due to visit the county to support the labour candidates a fortnight ago , but cancelled after the manchester terror attack .
a full list of all candidates standing in the telford seat can be seen on the bbc constituency page .

documents.title: on midlands today from 18:30 : farming 's future after election
text: on midlands today this evening , we 'll be looking at the future of the midlands ' farming industry after next week 's general election .

in the region , it is a £ 2bn industry and , post-brexit , whatever new government is elected , it will have to bring in its own ideas about agriculture which could have a massive impact on all of us .
i 've been hearing the promises of all the politicians for our farmers and you 'll hear what could happen after next thursday on bbc one this evening from 18:30 .
author: David Gregory-Kumar
Science correspondent, BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: weather : dry and sunny over the weekend
text: we might see some rain tonight , but it should be a sunny weekend for most of us .
it will be a little cooler though , with temperatures staying below 20c ( 68f ) .
author: Rebecca Wood
BBC Weather

documents.title: wait goes on for waitrose decision on new shrewsbury store
text: supermarket giant waitrose says it is no closer to a decision over whether to build a shrewsbury store that was given planning permission five years ago .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: warning after rural break-ins
text: people in rural parts of south shropshire are being warned to be on their guard after a series of burglaries in the last week .
homes in upton cressett and cleobury mortimer were broken into , along with another in tenbury wells .
the thieves took power tools along with a handbag and a wallet .

documents.title: police condemn 'nasty attack ' on teenage girl
text: a teenage girl has been reportedly attacked by two women in the woodside area of telford .
the attack happened on a footpath off woodside avenue last night and the police describe it as a `` nasty assault on a lone girl '' which could have resulted in her suffering serious injuries .
the young victim hurt her head and ribs .

documents.title: diy sos broadcast date announced
text: an episode of diy sos filmed in telford earlier this year will be broadcast on 22 june on bbc one , the show has announced .
volunteer workmen from across shropshire gave up their time to convert the home of 12-year-old matthew cooper , who has spent more than a year in hospital , receiving hospital for a brain tumour .

documents.title: football : the new saints learn of potential champions league opponents
text: the new saints now know who their potential opponents are in the first qualifying round of the champions league .
now the league seasons are complete across europe , uefa have been able to draw up the seedings and the welsh champions , based in oswestry , will face one of the following teams .
the first legs of those qualifying matches will be played on 27/28 june , with the return leg on 4/5 july .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: weston park opens cellars to visitors
text: the cellars at weston park are going to be opened up to the public for the first time next thursday .
they 're one of the oldest parts of the stately home and are thought to date back to medieval times .
in the past , they stored the wine for the house , but these days they contain a pool table and are only seen by outsiders when the house is rented out for private parties .
there will be a second open day on 16 july .

documents.title: conservationists look to clean up spawning grounds
text: the severn rivers trust says it will work with local landowners to improve the water quality on an 8km stretch the river worfe near worfield .
the project is due to take 18 months and the trust says the aim is to stop bank erosion and run-off from nearby fields harming spawning-beds in the river bed .
the charity says water quality and damage to the river bed has been a problem in that section of the river for two decades .
where you get bank-erosion and silt influx and stuff like that , that on the whole generally tends to impact on the river bed where you get invertebrates and it chokes up fish spawning habitats . ''

documents.title: football : more friendlies lined up by the new saints
text: the new saints have announced two more pre-season friendlies , the first against anglesey games at park hall next tuesday .
the club says that will be followed by a match against brickfield rangers the following tuesday and both will kick off at 19:45 .
in between those two games there will be a behind-closed-doors match in manchester against a football academy set up by the leicester city and england footballer jamie vardy .

tns announced yesterday they would be heading to scotland later in the month , to play friendlies against rangers and st johnstone , ahead of their champions league qualifiers , but a third game against aberdeen has been cancelled .

documents.title: children as young as eight reported over racism in schools
text: in the last year , 12 children below the age of 14 , the youngest just eight years old , have been reported to west mercia police over racist incidents in schools .
the offences range from harassment to assault and figures released by the force also show a steady rise in the number of incidents , from eight in 2014 to 19 last year .
there were also three adults reported last year and four incidents in which an age was n't recorded .

documents.title: huge concerts to become shrewsbury fixture
text: shrewsbury will get to host another huge music concert after nearly 10,000 people packed out the quarry for let 's rock .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: young shropshire chefs reach finals of seafood competition
text: we might be miles from the nearest coast , but two trainee chefs from new college in wellington have won places at the finals of the uk young seafood chef of the year .
adam ashley ( left ) , who is 20 and 17-year-old joseph little ( right ) were chosen to travel to grimsby later this month after impressing the judges in the western regional heats .
the menu they presented in the qualifying round included seared salmon , baked cod loin , and pan-fried plaice .

documents.title: charity match for american football team
text: the county 's american football team , shropshire revolution , plays its annual charity match this sunday , at home to the humber warhawks .
this year , the charity they are supporting is the severn hos and kick-off at the oakengates leisure centre pitch is at 14:30 .
on-the-field the revolution have made a perfect start to the season and sit at the top of the nfc 2 south with a 4-0 record .

documents.title: whitchurch joins 'worldwide whitchurch weekend '
text: whitchurch is joining other towns sharing the same name around the world in a three-day `` worldwide whitchurch weekend '' .
the entertainment , which starts this evening , will include dancing , an ale trail and canal boat trips along with a festival in the jubilee park tomorrow .
the idea of linking whitchurches around the world started at whitchurch in hampshire two years ago and it involves more than a dozen towns .

documents.title: big growth in food exports
text: belton farm 's experience mirrors that of many other food producers across the country .
figures released earlier this week showed british food and drink exports as a whole grew by 8.3 % year-on-year to £ 4.9bn .
british wine exports saw the greatest growth by volume , climbing 13.8 % , while the value of the uk 's cheese exports jumped 29.1 % to £ 145.3m , thanks in part to a spike in sales to france .

documents.title: cheese-makers travel to united states to boost exports
text: the award-winning whitchurch cheese-makers belton farm are off to anaheim in the united states this weekend , to try to boost sales over there .
the company says around 15 % of its sales are exports and that the usa is its biggest market , with a lot of cheese going to new jersey .
belton also said it saw exports rise last year , partly because of an `` advantageous exchange rate '' between the pound and the dollar .
sterling has fallen by about 16 % against the dollar since britain voted to leave the eu last june , making uk produce more competitive overseas .

documents.title: cricket : rain could disrupt opening shropshire championship game
text: shropshire are due to start their minor counties championship campaign away to wales on sunday , but the weather is n't looking good , with rain forecast for all three days .
the game is due to be played at pontarddulais cricket club and former captain james ralph has been added to a shropshire team that performed well in the championship games last season .
shropshire under-performed in the one-day games early this season , but their one success came against the wales minor counties side .

documents.title: council apologises for shrewsbury roadworks disruption
text: shropshire council has apologised for the disruption caused by roadworks in shrewsbury .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: cheese producer scoops ruck of awards
text: shropshire cheese manufacturer belton farm has won a host of national awards .
the whitchurch-based company secured 21 prizes at the british cheese awards .
that includes four gold medals , as well as prizes for best export and best creamery cheese .
ludlow food centre has also been named among the winners .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: £ 60k cash injection to improve natural habitat on river worfe
text: a £ 60,000 project is under way to improve a stretch of the river worfe , near bridgnorth .
it 's being led by the severn rivers trust , which wants it to be a more suitable habitat for things like salmon , eels , otters and water voles .
work on the 8km-stretch around worfield and beckbury , is expected to last 18 months .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: gobowen hospital celebrates being named best in country
text: the robert jones and agnes hunt hospital is celebrating being named best in the country in a survey of patients .
the gobowen hospital , which specialises in orthopaedic treatment , was named best for overall care .

mark brandreth , its chief executive , said the `` fantastic '' accolade was all the more important as it came from patients , many of whom he said were at a `` very vulnerable '' point in their lives .
it 's a small hospital and it makes it a very friendly hospital in many ways . ''

documents.title: popular oswestry police sergeant hanged himself at hospital unit
text: a dedicated oswestry-based police sergeant hanged himself while being treated as a patient in a psychiatric unit , an inquest has heard .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: wrekin conservative candidate leaves hustings early
text: the conservative candidate in the wrekin , mark pritchard , has left a hustings early , unhappy at being filmed and having been jeered by the audience .

it happened at a meeting organised by telford trades council , after mr pritchard talked about a tv show he 'd seen where people went to food banks then `` smoked £ 10 packets of fags '' and had massive tvs .
mr pritchard has said this morning he does n't want to comment on events at the hustings .
at the same event , ukip candidate denis allen referred to his party leader paul nuttall as a `` muppet '' .
all six candidates standing in the wrekin constituency were at the event including dylan harrison ( lab ) , fay easton ( ind ) , rod keyes ( lib dem ) and pat mccarthy for the ( green party ) .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: young farmers given prestigious award
text: the federation of young farmers ' clubs in the county has been awarded the prestigious queens voluntary service award .
it 's the highest award given to local volunteer groups across the uk and recognises outstanding work in the community .
the award will be presented by the lord lieutenant of shropshire , sir algernon heber-percy later this summer .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: inquest hears how police sergeant killed himself in psychiatric unit
text: an oswestry police sergeant , who was found hanged while a patient in a psychiatric unit , had `` horrible experiences '' in his line of work , an inquest has heard .
the hearing in ruthin was told lee johnson was under investigation for alleged misconduct .
the 45-year-old father-of-two twice spoke of hanging himself at his home in pantymwyn and had been admitted as a voluntary patient to the unit at the wrexham maelor hospital .
the hearing continues today .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: train services from shrewsbury to cardiff affected this weekend
text: train services in shropshire will be affected by the uefa champions league final in cardiff this weekend .
arriva trains wales says services to and from the welsh capital will be `` extremely busy all day '' on saturday .
there 'll be limited services coming through the county in the evening .
the rail company says unless you have a ticket for the match , or your journey is essential , you should think about travelling another day .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: election panel : your views on the environment
text: today you 've been commenting on the key questions about the environment .
we asked :
what should we do to ensure we look after the environment ?
what are you worried about , if anything ?
what policies have you heard , if any , which you support ?
i think we need to develop green energy a lot more and the green party is best for this but wo n't get into power . ''
increase litter collection , more bins also need to look at the fumes from buses , taxis and planes do not punish the tax payer by putting the burden on them . ''
there should be greater incentives for people to buy smart or electric cars , such as no road tax or reduced insurance . ''
more investment in renewable power . ''

documents.title: on midlands today from 18:30 : transport impact on general election
text: on midlands today this evening we 're looking at transport - an important issue for many voters in the run-up to next week 's general election .
all the parties have been making pledges on transport and we 'll be examining what some of them are on bbc one from 18:30 .
author: Peter Plisner
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: more overnight maternity closures in ludlow and bridgnorth
text: the maternity units in bridgnorth and ludlow are going to be closed overnight again .
the shrewsbury and telford hospital trust says it 's because there is staff sickness at telford 's princess royal hospital and staff need to be redeployed there .
the two units will reopen at 08:00 tomorrow and women expecting to give birth tonight have been contacted and offered places elsewhere .

documents.title: weather : a fine end to the day but showers forecast tomorrow
text: it 's going to be a fine night across the region , but we are forecast some colder weather and rain tomorrow .
author: Shefali Oza
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: gobowen hospital rated best in country
text: the robert jones and agnes hunt hospital has been rated the best in the country for `` overall experience of care '' in the latest patient survey by the care quality commission .
patients at the specialist robert jones and agnes hunt hospital , surveyed last july , said they had more trust in their doctors than at any other hospital in england .
chief executive mark brandreth says `` the results truly reflect our determination to provide world class care and support '' .

documents.title: football : the new saints to travel to scotland
text: the new saints will be travelling to scotland to play some warm-up games ahead of their champions league qualifiers .
the welsh champions say they are planning behind-closed-doors friendlies with aberdeen , rangers and st johnstone in the second half of june .

documents.title: hanged officer had 'horrible experiences '
text: hanged officer had 'horrible experiences '

documents.title: shrewsbury watch tower to open to the public
text: a medieval watch tower in shrewsbury is going to be opened up to the public the weekend after next .
the national trust has owned the tower since 1930 and says it was probably added to the walls during the reign of henry iv .
the tour will be the first of six scheduled this year .

documents.title: cars hit 10 lambs on road near ludlow
text: motorists have killed 10 lambs in about a fortnight on a road across a rural shropshire hill , with farmers calling for drivers to slow down and be more aware .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: car fire could be arson
text: a car fire in telford overnight could have been started deliberately , the fire service says .
it was called out to kingsland in arleston just before 03:00 .
another car fire , in dawley last night , is not being treated as sus

documents.title: your photos : sunshine and cloud in badger and newport
text: it 's been another fine day around shropshire , with temperatures up to 22c ( 72f ) in places .
these photos were taken by bbc weather watchers out and about around badger ( top ) and newport ( below ) .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: milestone marked for shropshire carers
text: three members of staff at a shropshire care home have clocked up more than 100 years of dedicated service .
author: Shropshire Live

documents.title: gp warned following woman 's pill death
text: gp warned following woman 's pill death

documents.title: haulage company staff told their jobs are safe after buy-out
text: staff at the telford haulage firm maiden 's have been told their jobs are safe despite the sale of the company to the kinaxia logistics group .
the company employs just under 100 people , based at donnington wood , and has a fleet of 65 vehicles
it was set up in 1931 and has been run by four generations of the maiden family .

documents.title: more roadside drink and drug-driving checks
text: random roadside checks are to be carried out all times of the day and night in shropshire this summer , as part of a crackdown on drink and drug driving .
across the west mercia force area , 122 people were killed or seriously injured as a result of collisions involving drink or drugs over the past three years .
the force says almost half of serious collisions linked to drink and drugs involve young people and are particularly concerned about male drivers aged between the ages of 17 and 30 .
author: Faith Page
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: photos released by football violence detectives
text: police are looking for four shrewsbury town fans wanted in connection with a fight involving rival bristol rovers supporters - they have released these photos of men they want to talk to .
the violence , involving about 15 people , broke out near the memorial stadium while the match was being played on 1 april .

documents.title: cricket : ralph returns to shropshire side
text: shropshire have named their former captain james ralph in the squad for their opening minor counties ' league game of the season .
the county failed to get through the group stages of the knock-out programme , so will be looking for a good start to their three-day season .
the game will start this sunday away to wales at pontarddulais .
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: seven child abuse claims against dead shropshire gp investigated
text: west mercia police say they 're now investigating seven reports of historical sexual abuse involving a shropshire gp who died in 2000 .
the allegations concern the abuse of teenagers and children , one who was just nine years old , in whitchurch .
police say they are in the process of speaking to victims and collating reports after more people came forward .

documents.title: ex-footballer 's work goes on display
text: paintings by the former wolves footballer jody craddock have gone on display in ellesmere along with work by a number of local artists .
ellesmere college is hosting the exhibition , which will be free to get in and open until sunday .
craddock says he 's been interested in art since he was at school and now that he has retired he finally has time to devote to his hobby .

documents.title: on midlands today from 13:30 : rises in cyber child sex offences
text: on midlands today this lunchtime , we 'll hear the latest on cyber-related sex offences against children .
that 's because a freedom of information request by the nspcc 's found increases recorded by some of our police forces , including west mercia .
i 've been looking into the details and will have more from 13:30 on bbc one .
author: Sarah Bishop
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: watch : ironbridge family inspired by suffrage struggle
text: a hundred years ago , florence bailey lived in ironbridge and could n't vote .
today , her descendants feel strongly about their right to go to the polls at the 2017 general election .
author: Johnty O'Donnell
Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: general election : green candidate criticises health spending
text: the green party candidate standing for election in ludlow has told a bbc debate the nhs is n't getting enough money from the government .
hilary wendt went on to say this means `` staff are placed under intolerable levels of stress and are being forced to make compromises on quality on a daily basis '' .
she also said that `` mistakes happen in over-stretched systems '' .

documents.title: telford zoo takes action after inspection report
text: a telford tourist attraction today defended its record after issues were raised by an inspection .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: general election : lib dem candidate says money wasted on hospitals review
text: the liberal democrat standing for election in the ludlow constituency has criticised the money spent on the nhs review of hospital services in the county .
the future fit review has cost at least £ 3m over three years .
heather kidd described it as a `` mess '' and said it had `` wasted a huge amount of money that could have been put into the front line '' .
mrs kidd also says the government has failed to provide guidance for reviews like future fit and needed to invest more in the health service .
and she said the nhs in shropshire was having recruitment problems , including the recruitment of rural gps .

documents.title: football : hutchinson returns to telford
text: afc telford united have brought back defender graham hutchinson .
he played on-loan for the club in the 2015-16 season , and manager rob smith said he 'd wanted to sign him last summer - but he joined worcester city instead .
smith said that while worcester struggled in the national north , hutchinson had an `` excellent season '' and that he was `` delighted to have him on board '' .
hutch was someone we wanted to keep hold of last season but we could not get near worcester city 's offer that was on the table . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: general election : labour candidate criticises nhs organisational changes
text: the labour candidate for the ludlow constituency , dr julia buckley , says the main pressure on the nhs , comes from the way it 's organised .
she says the introduction of the health and social care act , by the coalition government of conservatives and liberal democrats , has allowed privatisation to take over the nhs .
dr buckley says 45 % of all new contracts within the nhs are now non-nhs providers and gave an example of an increase of 9 % on admin , which she maintains takes away from the front line .
that , she says , is the equivalent of 30,000 gps .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: general election : conservative backs shrewsbury for new 24-hour emergency centre
text: philip dunne , the conservative candidate for the ludlow constituency , says he believes shrewsbury is the right place for a new 24-hour emergency centre .

he supports the recommendation made by local health bosses to choose the town ahead of telford , arguing that the centrality of the transport links and the fact that 10 % of the patients coming into a & e are from mid wales , make it the obvious choice .

mr dunne , who was a health minister in the last government , also added that whatever happened with the review , it was important that substantial emergency treatment was retained at the princess royal hospital in telford .
he wants a decision on the future of healthcare services in the county to be made as soon as possible .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: college principal says cuts could n't wait until merger
text: the principal of telford college of arts and technology ( tcat ) says the cuts he 's announced could n't be put off until the merger with wellington 's new college in august .
graham guest has started consultations with unions and staff , over a potential reduction of 76 posts , around a sixth of tcat 's staff , saving , he says , £ 1.7m a year .
fill-in and agency jobs will be significantly reduced and some staff will be given the opportunity to retrain and take up different positions across the college .
tcat college for a long time has been over-staffed and difficult decisions have n't been made .
and that was the decision i made on friday . ''
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: shrewsbury 24 campaign expects appeal decision by end of june
text: the shrewsbury 24 campaign group is expecting a decision on whether it can take its case back to the court of appeal by the end of june .
the group wants the court to quash the convictions of 24 trade union who were charged following an industrial dispute in the town in the 1970s .
the 24 men include the comedian and actor ricky tomlinson .

documents.title: call for review over shrewsbury roadworks 'chaos '
text: roadworks which have left parts of shrewsbury in gridlock over recent weeks have been branded `` diabolical '' amid calls for a review of their planning .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: hospital workers fined for parking in visitors ' car park
text: two members of staff who work at the royal shrewsbury hospital say they 've been fined for parking in the visitors ' car park when the staff car park was full .
both women paid an extra charge to park there , despite already paying a monthly fee to park in the staff car park .
one appealed against the fine , but that was rejected and now has to pay an £ 80 fine .
the hospital trust says staff who are disputing the fines , should contact the car parking team and they 'll do what they can to help .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cyber sex offences against children up by 87 %
text: the number of cyber-related sex offences against children , recorded by west mercia police , increased by 87 % last year .
figures obtained by the nspcc show there were 213 offences recorded last year , compared with 114 the year before .
the majority of the victims in the west mercia force area , which includes shropshire , herefordshire and worcestershire were aged between 13 and 15 .
but 10 of them were either 10 or younger .
one of the victims was just three years old .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: church warden comes face-to-face with thief
text: a shropshire churchwarden has found herself face-to-face with a thief stealing money from the collection tin .
police say the man , who appeared to be balding and in his 50s , jammed the main door of the church of st peter and st paul in wem with a knife .
she used another entrance to get into the church and attempted to speak to him , but he ran off and escaped on a bike
a padlock on the church collection box had been broken and money taken .
author: Tim Page
News Editor, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: watch : police in telford get body-worn video cameras
text: west mercia police has promised to equip all front-line officers and staff with body-worn cameras by the end of the year and today the first have been issued to officers in telford .
the force says the cameras are small and simple to operate and hopes they will improve confidence in the police .

documents.title: election panel : thoughts on crime
text: in the run-up to 8 june 's general election , the bbc has been sharing voters ' thoughts .
the bbc 's election panel in england is made up of voters with a range of political views drawn from across the nation .
today it 's been asked about tackling crime - in particular , if we need more prisons or fewer .
here are views from around the region :
i think we need more prisons , with more help for the prisoners .
also , we need to make them more secure so that no contraband can get into the prisons . ''
prisons should be used for the worst offenders and maybe community service should be used more regularly . ''
we need harsher punishments , as prison is n't a punishment but a nice place to stay . ''
no party has effective policies .
there should be harsher sentences , with the criminals made to pay for their penal costs from their proceeds .
making sure that crime does not pay . ''
author: BBC Politics

documents.title: body cameras issued to telford police officers
text: the first body-cameras have been issued to police officers in telford .
west mercia police is spending £ 1m on them and 240 staff in telford will be getting them .
the force says the cameras , which record everything the officer sees , will help deter crime and provide clear evidence of incidents .
it was criticised last year when it emerged there was no video evidence of the tasering of the ex-footballer dalian atkinson .
video captures events in a way that can not be represented in written statements .
footage helps us show the real impact a crime can have on victims and helps ensure total transparency in police actions and in a suspect 's behaviour . ''

documents.title: shrewsbury roundabout work nearly complete
text: work on shrewsbury 's meole brace roundabout is more or less complete and it is now fully open to traffic again .
shropshire council had planned to have the job done by 30 may and says there are now just some `` minor finishing-off works on the island requiring minimal traffic management '' .
the authority added that three-way traffic lights would remain at the roman road junction for another two weeks , while work is completed there .
the roadworks have involved remodelling the island , with the aim of improving traffic flow and making it easier for pedestrians and cyclists to cross .
they have been part of a wider programme of roadworks around the town .

documents.title: college principal still optimistic despite staff cuts
text: the principal of telford college of arts and technology says he is optimistic about its future , despite having to cut the annual staffing budget by £ 1.7m .

graham guest only started the job 23 days ago , but said he knew the `` college had some challenges , both financially and from a quality perspective '' and that he believed the `` opportunities far outweigh those challenges '' .
mr guest said he also knew when he arrived that part of his role was to stabilise the finances and that it had been having money problems since november 2015 .
he announced last week that 76 of the 480 jobs at the college were at risk and a 30-day period of consultation is now under way .
the redundancies are about the college spending far too much money , more money than it actually brings in terms of government funding . ''

documents.title: british stone skimming championships appeals for volunteers
text: the organisers of the british stone skimming championships in south shropshire are looking for a `` new band of younger , fit volunteers '' to help out with the event in july .
it will be the ninth year the tournament at walcot lake has taken place and extra games have been added this year .
the event will raise money for the rnli this year and the volunteers are needed to prepare the lake , set up tents and move around large numbers of stones .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: your questions : is the benthall water spout safe ?
text: last month we looked into the history of a water spout in benthall , in response to a reader 's question .
and we promised an update when we were able to find out if the water was safe to drink .
shropshire council got back to us and said it would advise against it .
karen collier , shropshire council 's regulatory services operations manager , said the water from the spout `` is not intended for human consumption '' , so the authority does n't test it .

she said people were advised not to drink water from any unknown or natural sources `` such as streams or lakes '' because they `` can be contaminated with bacteria or other things which can be harmful to health '' .

many of the organisms and chemicals that can make water unsafe to drink are invisible to the naked eye , and do not necessarily cause any taste or odour , and so you can not judge whether water is safe just because it is clear . ''

documents.title: ice hockey : watkins takes on tigers general manager role
text: telford tigers head coach tom watkins will be taking on an extra role next season and will be acting as general manager too .
he will be responsible for building the squads for the two nihl teams and he has already started talking to potential signings .

documents.title: ex-footballer craddock says team-mates were impressed by his artwork
text: here 's more artwork by the ex-wolves footballer jody craddock .

his work is going on display at ellesmere college and he said his former team-mates were `` quietly impressed '' when they saw what he 'd been up to - and some asked him to paint portraits of them or their families .
he said art had been a passion since he was at school and when he can , he spends most of the day painting .

documents.title: work starts on telford heritage trail
text: volunteers have started walking out the route of a new heritage trail around north telford today , and are looking for thoughts from people living in the area .
the st georges community group learned last week it was getting £ 10,000 from the heritage lottery fund to celebrate the industrial and cultural history of the area with the trail .
the money will be spent on setting up the trail route , a website and app , a series of community events , and training for a team of project volunteers .

BBC Radio Shropshire

documents.title: car fire could be arson

firefighters were called out at 02:05 and found it was out by the time they arrived at red kite close .

documents.title: football : age is irrelevant says sadler
text: mat sadler insists he 's as fit as he 's ever been after signing a new two-year deal at shrewsbury town - at the age of 30 .
sadler was town 's player of the year last season , proving himself one of the most consistent members of the team .
i feel great , i look after myself and hopefully i 've shown that age is irrelevant .
i train everyday , i can be available for matches and long may that continue . ''

documents.title: general election : green candidate wants flexible approach to brexit
text: luke shirley , the green party candidate standing for election in the telford constituency , said the country needed to be flexible over the brexit negotiations and be `` prepared to meet in the middle on certain things '' .
speaking in a bbc radio debate last night , he said that might be difficult to communicate to people , because `` so much misinformation was given '' during the referendum campaign .
tonight the four ludlow candidates will battle it out on bbc radio shropshire , from 18:00 until 19:00 .

documents.title: police appeal over fatal crash
text: the death of a motorcyclist in a crash near woofferton on saturday is being investigated by the police and they are hoping to find witnesses to the incident .
he was driving a black and gold bike which was involved in a collision with a silver honda cr-v on the a49 near the junction with the b4362 , just before midday .
the man suffered serious injuries in the crash and was pronounced dead at the scene .

documents.title: general election : lib dem attacks 'short-sighted ' brexit vote
text: the liberal democrat standing for the telford constituency , susan king , has called the decision to leave the eu a `` short-sighted '' decision .
speaking in a bbc radio shropshire debate yesterday evening , she said businesses like hers relied on `` some very capable , enthusiastic and hard-working eastern europeans '' .
at 18:00 today the four candidates for the ludlow constituency will face-off in another debate on bbc radio shropshire .

documents.title: general election : labour candidate supports 'verdict of people ' over brexit
text: the labour candidate standing in the telford constituency , kuldip sahota , says he will fight for a good brexit deal , despite voting to remain in the eu .

the four candidates for the ludlow constituency debate the big election issues from 18:00 this evening .

text: midfielder gary deegan has left shrewsbury town after the club agreed to cancel his contract .
he made 48 appearances last season after joining from southend united .

text: lucy allan , the conservative candidate for the telford constituency , says she believes theresa may can make a success of brexit .

in the previous parliament , ms allen backed the leave campaign and said last night : `` if we can not get a good deal there must be no deal . ''
tonight , the candidates competing for the ludlow constituency will be in the studio for a debate .

he says he 's been into art since his school days but has relished having more time after hanging up his boots .

text: craig harrison has thanked the new saints for an incredible six years as manager .
he takes charge of hartlepool this week .
during his time at tns he won six welsh premier league titles and steered the oswestry club into the european champions league .
but harrison admits he 's now relishing the chance to prove himself in the english system .
i had a fantastic time there [ tns ] and i 'm really grateful for the opportunity , but it was time for a new challenge '' .

text: villagers in alveley , near bridgnorth , have lost their post office after 20 years of trading .
the couple who ran it were unable to find a buyer for their business , and now it 's closed down .
the local parish clerk says the service is `` irreplaceable '' - but they 're hoping to set up an alternative form of postal service for the community .

documents.title: yellow stickers for telford private hire vehicles
text: private hire vehicles registered in telford will be getting yellow signs on their doors , to help people tell them apart from taxis .

telford and wrekin council is issuing the stickers , and says it 's important because people getting in a private hire vehicle without booking in advance wo n't be covered by insurance and the driver will be breaking the law by taking them .
taxis , also known as hackney carriage vehicles , can be hailed in the street and are allowed to queue at taxi-ranks .
they can be pre-booked and should have a meter and a fare-table on display .
private hire vehicles look like regular saloons or people-carriers and have to be booked in advance .

documents.title: the forgotten fish of the river severn
text: the river severn is set to undergo a £ 20m makeover designed to make it more accessible to a forgotten variety of fish - the shad .
once a staple dish for people along the river , shad populations have plummeted since weirs were introduced .
it is hoped new fish passes will help boost numbers not only of the shad , but other migratory fish too .
author: David Gregory-Kumar
Science correspondent, BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: chemical attacks very low in west mercia area
text: over the past three years , people in shropshire , herefordshire and worcestershire have been attacked with soft drinks , soup , sheep dip , coffee and even hot onions , west mercia police have revealed .
there have also been reports of people being sprayed with bleach , cs gas , paint and weed killer and one report a person being threatened with acid .
the numbers of these incidents involving items being thrown are very , very low however , with just 81 recorded over those three years .

documents.title: police commissioner praises public response to terror threat
text: people living in shropshire , herefordshire and worcestershire have been praised by the west mercia police and crime commissioner for their response to the raised terror threat last week .
john campion said it ranged from people `` reporting things that concerned them , through to offering officers refreshments while out on patrol '' .
mr campion 's comments follow the lowering of the terrorist threat-level to `` severe '' and he also praised the `` bravery , commitment and professionalism '' of his staff .
to see that level of support has been heart-warming and shows the positivity , togetherness and determination that so many people have drawn from what was such a horrific incident . ''

documents.title: telford campaigner says 'legal high ' ban has been effective
text: a telford woman who campaigned against so-called `` legal-highs '' following the death of her brother , says the introduction of a ban on psychoactive substances a year ago has `` made a difference '' .
charlotte delo lost jamie penn in 2014 a year ago tomorrow and said there was now greater awareness , especially among younger people .
ms delo added that there was more the government could do though , including more funding for research into the effects of the drugs .

documents.title: man hurt in llynclys crash
text: a man in his 80s is in hospital after he was involved in a crash with a van near llynclys just before midday .
his car rolled over near the white lion pub and he was taken to the royal shrewsbury hospital with arm and hand injuries .
a man in his 60s was treated at the scene for back pain .

documents.title: general election : telford lib dem raises brexit health concerns
text: the lib dem standing for the telford constituency says she fears health professionals will leave the princess royal hospital because of brexit .

the four candidates for the telford constituency will take part in a live debate on bbc radio shropshire , starting at 18:00 .

documents.title: residents win community centre battle
text: people in a shropshire council-owned housing estate in highley have defeated plans to charge them for using their local community centre .
the residents living on wilkins close were angry after been told they 'd be charged £ 10.50 a week each to use the facilities there , when previously they 'd had access for free .
the organisation managing the homes and the community centre on behalf of the council said the money would be used to hire a `` housing support officer '' to help the residents .
shropshire towns and rural housing ltd has now said residents will now be asked if they want to pay for that support officer .

lucy allan said progress had been made on the issue of services at telford 's princess royal hospital and that it would retain both a `` substantial a & e '' and `` women and children 's services at the women and children 's unit '' .
there will be an hour-long live debate involving all four candidates for the telford constituency on bbc radio shropshire at 18:00 .

documents.title: police say it 's 'back to business as usual ' after terror threat
text: west mercia police say it 's back to `` business as usual '' following the government 's decision to reduce the uk terror threat level .
assistant chief constable martin evans said it had been `` overwhelmed by the positive response our officers recieved '' .
he added there had been `` numerous occasions where people have gone out of their way to say thank you to our officers '' - including it seems singer tony hadley ( at a concert in shrewsbury .

documents.title: general election : telford labour candidate raises hospital concerns
text: kuldip sahota , labour 's candidate for the telford constituency , is accusing the conservatives of breaking promises on the future of telford 's hospital .

councillor sahota said the health secretary , jeremy hunt , had guaranteed both the county 's accident and emergency departments would remain open - but that now appears in doubt , with proposals on the table to downgrade the a & e at telford 's princess royal hospital .
the four candidates for the telford constituency will take part in a live debate on bbc radio shropshire at 18:00 this evening .

documents.title: volunteers remove old barbed wire to protect deer
text: volunteers from telford west wildlife group ( twwig ) have been clearing old barbed wire from woodland outside new works near lawley .
they took action after being contacted by people living nearby who say wild deer were trying to leap it and getting caught up in the top strand .
the team spent half a day clearing up rusty wire from a 400-metre stretch of former uk coal woodland owned by harworth estates , with the permission of the landowners .
we 've got rid of the old barbed wire now , but we want to ask landowners to consider removing double stranded barbed wire on long lengths of new fencing in the area . ''

documents.title: shropshire solider named in squad for invictus games
text: a former soldier from shropshire has been named in the british squad for the next invictus games - the international sporting event for wounded , injured and sick servicemen and women .
shrewsbury-based kevin drake will join the british party going to toronto , in canada , in september .
sergeant drake had a leg amputated last year after an injury in 2013 , and has faced a series of operations .
he hopes to compete in wheelchair basketball , wheelchair tennis and rowing at the games .

documents.title: takeover bid : what afc telford united say
text: the club say the irish consortium would be unable to purchase the proposed 51 % of the shares without `` going to the market to get a loan '' .

in a statement the club said : `` he [ anthony mcmullen ] stated that he could only purchase 3 % of the shares , but that he would want to immediately take 51 % control , he did not state when , if at all , he would pay the remaining 48 % . ''
the consortium told bbc radio shropshire they wanted to take the club into the football league and go full time within a year .
they 'd also bring in a director of football and were willing to put £ 250,000 up front into the club or invest £ 20,000 a month .

the individual declined to sign a non disclosure agreement , declined to demonstrate proof of funds , did not make any written or confirmed verbal offer to purchase shares , did not ask for any financial information or request to do any due diligence . ''

documents.title: bucks turn down takeover bid
text: afc telford united have rejected an offer from an irish consortium to become the club 's majority shareholder .
the group led by businessman anthony mcmullen wanted 51 % of the club but telford say they have concerns over the investment arrangement .
the club announced in october last year that they were looking for new investment .
the bucks said the investors have n't shown any proof of funding and would need to get a loan to generate the funds .
so as it stands telford ca n't accept the terms on which the consortium wants to invest .
they were also concerned that mr mcmullen previously failed to buy scottish side livingston after the board there had reservations .
author: BBC Sport
